Legal_Issue: Whether the Citizenship Judge correctly applied the residency requirement under paragraph 5(1)(c) of the Citizenship Act
Application_Facts: Applicant's citizenship application was denied due to alleged failure to meet residency requirements
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the Citizenship Judge's decision
Court_Ruling: Appeal granted; case remanded to a different Citizenship Judge
Defendant_Behavior: Judge did not consider Re Koo factors, relied on irrelevant evidence, failed to communicate concerns to applicant
Grounds_for_Claim: Failure to apply proper legal test, procedural unfairness, lack of consideration of relevant factors
Assessment_Factor: Residency assessment based on Re Koo [1993] factors
Procedural_Issue: Failure to uphold natural justice, lack of transparency in decision-making
Evidence_Used: Irrelevant evidence relied upon by the judge
Relief_Sought: Re-evaluation of citizenship application by a different judge
Governing_Rule: Principles from Re Koo [1993] and natural justice
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to consider required factors, reliance on irrelevant evidence
Harm_Assessment: Unfair denial of citizenship application due to flawed process
Cause_Description: Citizenship application rejected based on incorrect application of residency rules and procedural unfairness
Evidence_Handling: Improper handling: relevant factors ignored, irrelevant evidence considered
Evidence_Issues: Lack of proper communication of concerns to applicant, failure to disclose issues affecting decision
Residency_Compliance: Central issue: whether applicant met physical presence and residency obligations
Evidence_Assessment: Inadequate and unreasonable assessment of residency based on established precedent
Decision_Rationale: Decision was unreasonable due to failure to apply Re Koo factors and procedural flaws
Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to follow proper evidentiary standards in assessing residency
Legal_Standard_Applied: Reasonableness of administrative decision under Canadian administrative law
